item.title: Addition to Castle Wars
item.description:
@586 wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:19, topic:421431”][quote author=586 link=topic=524093.msg3814213#msg3814213 date=1321184224]

What RiiPii is trying to say I think is that explaining you code is just that extra step towards having a great tutorial. While we don’t usually lock threads because they don’t explain code (unless they’re reallllly bad) it’s always a plus to explain what you can to help foster a learning environment instead of a ‘leeching’ environment

In all honestly, I flicked through a couple of threads today, they don’t explain everything. E.G.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

There are many more within this section. I do not see any of you posting on theses threads stating the same things as you are posting on my thread.

Anyways, due to the fact everyone is having a bitch fit about the tutorial not being specific whenever I have time I will be more specific with what they are adding.
[/quote]

Oh you’re cool, pick my tutorials because they’re better than yours. Do you already have a grudge against me? Nobody comes to the tutorial section to learn anyways, it’s just leech leech leech.[/quote]

Sorry to burst your bubble when you’re asking a question you are supposed to put a ? after it. I didn’t pick your tutorial because I had a grudge against you, I chose them at random. I didn’t mean to offend anyone in anyway it was just an example… If I did offend you, I apologize for it.

Read full topic

item.title: Addition to Castle Wars
item.description:
@586 wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:8, topic:421431”][quote author=586 link=topic=524093.msg3813644#msg3813644 date=1321140143]
Pretty much summed everything up for me.

  1. I do not visit Moparscape on a regular basis as much as you do.
  2. I thought there was another section for snippets, not threads (the vast majority of rsps forums I visit have different sections for their snippets not an individual thread for them).
  3. You were proved wrong that this isn’t a snippet, it’s a tutorial now go fuck off from this thread.
    [/quote]

Not many members even know about it, so chill your nuts batman.[/quote]

I wouldn’t have told him to fuck off only if he replied to my post in a polite manner.

RiiPiiNFtW:

Davidi was right about what you quoted however, he forgot to mention tutorials also explain their code. If it isn’t explained, nothing is being learned. It’s just copy and paste. So, once again, your a dumbass.

Once again, you have been proved wrong by two moderators. I hope you go away now, there are times where you are wrong ya’ know. Want to continue this conversation? Sure, I would be delighted to speak to you over Msn discussing about this matter. By the way, it isn’t my fault the forums don’t include a copy and paste section.

Davidi2:

Unlocked, he proved it was him that made the original tutorial.

Thanks, I have repped you!

Read full topic

item.title: Addition to Castle Wars
item.description:
@586 wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:5, topic:421431”]It’s a tutorial Riip.

[quote author=Davidi2 link=action=profile;u=324294 date=1320095381]
But I think I know more about what a snippet is than you do. Most of the tutorials out today are copy and paste, the difference between a tutorial and a snippet is simple. A snippet usually is a short amount of code or ONE section of code that goes into ONE place and then you’re done. If its interspersed throughout the server (not just one class or portion of code), it’s considered a tutorial. It’s a case-by-case basis, and just being ‘copy and paste’ doesn’t make it a snippet.
[/quote][/quote]

deathschaos9:

While this is considered a tutorial, I would appreciate it if the code was explained on the off chance someone is trying to learn something.

RiiPiiNFtW:

There is a snippets thread dumbass. Learn to read.

Pretty much summed everything up for me.

  1. I do not visit Moparscape on a regular basis as much as you do.
  2. I thought there was another section for snippets, not threads (the vast majority of rsps forums I visit have different sections for their snippets not an individual thread for them).
  3. You were proved wrong that this isn’t a snippet, it’s a tutorial now go fuck off from this thread.

Read full topic

item.title: Addition to Castle Wars
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

It’s a tutorial Riip.

Davidi2:

But I think I know more about what a snippet is than you do. Most of the tutorials out today are copy and paste, the difference between a tutorial and a snippet is simple. A snippet usually is a short amount of code or ONE section of code that goes into ONE place and then you’re done. If its interspersed throughout the server (not just one class or portion of code), it’s considered a tutorial. It’s a case-by-case basis, and just being ‘copy and paste’ doesn’t make it a snippet.

Read full topic

item.title: Addition to Castle Wars
item.description:
@586 wrote:

If you used Satam666’s guide on adding Castle Wars, there were a couple of stuff that weren’t added.

Adding Doors

Go to ActionHandler.java and add this into it.

				case 4467:
				if (c.absX  == 2384 && c.absY == 3134) {
				c.getPA().movePlayer(2385, 3134, 0);
				}
				if (c.absX  == 2385 && c.absY == 3134) {
				c.getPA().movePlayer(2384, 3134, 0);
				}
				break;
				
				case 4427:
				if (c.absX  == 2373 && c.absY == 3120) {
				c.getPA().movePlayer(2373, 3119, 0);
				}
				if (c.absX  == 2373 && c.absY == 3119) {
				c.getPA().movePlayer(2373, 3120, 0);
				}
				break;
				
				case 4428:
				if (c.absX  == 2372 && c.absY == 3120) {
				c.getPA().movePlayer(2372, 3119, 0);
				}
				if (c.absX  == 2372 && c.absY == 3119) {
				c.getPA().movePlayer(2372, 3120, 0);
				}
				break;
				
				case 4465:
				if (c.absX  == 2414 && c.absY == 3073) {
				c.getPA().movePlayer(2415, 3073, 0);
				}
				if (c.absX  == 2415 && c.absY == 3073) {
				c.getPA().movePlayer(2414, 3073, 0);
				}
				break;
				
				case 4424:
				if (c.absX  == 2427 && c.absY == 3087) {
				c.getPA().movePlayer(2427, 3088, 0);
				}
				if (c.absX  == 2427 && c.absY == 3088) {
				c.getPA().movePlayer(2427, 3087, 0);
				}
				break;
				
				case 4423:
				if (c.absX  == 2426 && c.absY == 3087) {
				c.getPA().movePlayer(2426, 3088, 0);
				}
				if (c.absX  == 2426 && c.absY == 3088) {
				c.getPA().movePlayer(2426, 3087, 0);
				}
				break;

Adding Bandages

Go to Food.java

If you scroll down a little you will see this:

		ROCKTAIL(15272,23,"Rocktail"),
		MANTA(391,22,"Manta Ray"),
		SHARK(385,20,"Shark"),
		LOBSTER(379,12,"Lobster"),
		TROUT(333,7,"Trout"),
		SALMON(329,9,"Salmon"),
		SWORDFISH(373,14,"Swordfish"),
		TUNA(361,10,"Tuna"),
		MONKFISH(7946,16,"Monkfish"),
		SEA_TURTLE(397,21,"Sea Turtle"),

Add this into it.

BANDAGES(4049,3,"Bandages"),

If you were inside of Castle Wars you would be able to teleport and the minigame would still be in progress

Add this into Client.java

public boolean inCw() {
	if (CastleWars.isInCwWait(this) || (CastleWars.isInCw(this)) {
        return true;
        }
	return false;
}

Search for this in PlayerAssistant.java

public void startTeleport2(int x, int y, int height) {

Below it add

		if(c.inCw()) {
			c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of this minigame!");
			return;
		}

Then search for

public void startTeleport(int x, int y, int height, String teleportType) {

Then add this below it.

	    if(c.inCw()) {
			c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of this minigame!");
			return;
		}

Attacking inside of Castle Wars

Go to Player.java

Search for this

public boolean inWild() {

You will see something identical to this.

	public boolean inWild() {
		if(isInFala() || isInArd() || inFunPk()) {
		return true;
		}
		if(absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 3518 && absY < 3966 ||
			absX > 3343 && absX < 3384 && absY > 9619 && absY < 9660 ||
			absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 9918 && absY < 10366){ 	
			return true;
		}
		return false;
	}

Now change it to this.

	public boolean inWild() {
[COLOR="red"]Client c = (Client)this;[/COLOR]
		if([COLOR="Red"]c.inCw() ||[/COLOR] isInFala() || isInArd() || inFunPk()) {
		return true;
		}
		if(absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 3518 && absY < 3966 ||
			absX > 3343 && absX < 3384 && absY > 9619 && absY < 9660 ||
			absX > 2941 && absX < 3392 && absY > 9918 && absY < 10366){ 	
			return true;
		}
		return false;
	}

Now go into CombatAssistant.java

Search for this in CombatAssistant.java

public boolean checkReqs() {

If you scroll down a bit you will see something similar to this.

		if(Config.COMBAT_LEVEL_DIFFERENCE) {
			int combatDif1 = c.getCombat().getCombatDifference(c.combatLevel, Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerIndex].combatLevel);
			if(combatDif1 > c.wildLevel || combatDif1 > Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerIndex].wildLevel) {
				c.sendMessage("Your combat level difference is too great to attack that player here.");
				c.stopMovement();
				c.getCombat().resetPlayerAttack();
				return false;
			}
		}
		}

Edit it to this.

if(!c.inCw()){
		if(Config.COMBAT_LEVEL_DIFFERENCE) {
			int combatDif1 = c.getCombat().getCombatDifference(c.combatLevel, Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerIndex].combatLevel);
			if(combatDif1 > c.wildLevel || combatDif1 > Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerIndex].wildLevel) {
				c.sendMessage("Your combat level difference is too great to attack that player here.");
				c.stopMovement();
				c.getCombat().resetPlayerAttack();
				return false;
			}
		}
		}

Also above it add this:

		if (c.inCw()) {
		return true;
		}

Thanks for reading.

Read full topic
